intro: Gochnatia bahamensis, commonly known as the Bahamian gochnatia, is a flowering plant native to the Bahamas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions. It features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Gochnatia bahamensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological role in its native habitat.
